intro: Paepalanthus lagopodioides, commonly known as the woolly burhead, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are covered in dense, woolly hairs. The plant produces striking inflorescences with showy, brightly colored flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
